Articles.Content:
EDIT - Nevermind, this article is from July 2014 and was already discussed at length in the forums. Please ignore this post and move along.

http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2014-07/31/nasa-validates-impossible-space-drive

Edited January 23, 2015 by Vindaloo

Just dropping in here for others.

This is an article from July of last year, so no new info as of yet.

Vindaloo, prepare yourself, these threads tend to explode into some fairly heated fighting on why the drive is impossible and NASA should just ignore it and groups that insist NASA should pour vast quantities of funds into testing it out thoroughly.

Thanks for the attempt though!

This is I think the third time someone posted this "new" discovery in the last month alone... despite it being from summer 2014...

Please please please check the date on an article before you make a post. (Also, a simple forum search on Cannae Drive / EMdrive would have turned up dozens of threads.)

What would really interest me on this topic is if anything genuinely new happened in the meantime. Any further papers on the subject, that sort of thing.

I'm hoping that they do some repeat tests and publish the results in the near future. I'm sceptical but hopeful that it will work.

Also yeah this same thing has been posted here half a dozen times by now.

This is I think the third time someone posted this "new" discovery in the last month alone... despite it being from summer 2014...

Please please please check the date on an article before you make a post. (Also, a simple forum search on Cannae Drive / EMdrive would have turned up dozens of threads.)

Shoot, you are correct. My bad.
